properties.name: Sea Lion Rookery Buffer Area - Marmot Island
properties.information:
No Take Area
Managed By: NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service
Effective From: to

Restricted:

1. No owner or operator of a vessel may enter this area.
2. No person may approach on land not privately owned within one-half statutory mile (0.8 kilometers) or within sight of a rookery site, whichever is greater.
3. Directed fishing for groundfish by vessels named on a Federal Fisheries Permit is prohibited.
4. No discharge of firearms within 100 yards of a steller sea lion.

Allowed:

Subsistence takings by Alaska Natives are exempt.
Certain activities may be exempt with prior written authorization from the NMFS Regional Administrator.
Emergency situations that present threats to the health, safety, or life of a person or a significant threat to the vessel or property are exempt.
Official government activities related to defense or other legitimate governmental activities are permitted.

Purpose:

To protect threatened Steller sea lions by creating a buffer around established rookeries.

More Information:

Get the latest news and information for commercial, subsistence, and sport fishing and hunting to ensure you are legally taking fish and wildlife.

- Emergency Orders and News for Sport Fishing
- Hunting and Trapping Announcements and Emergency Orders.

Additional Info:
Groundfish Hotline: 907-747-4882.
Environmental emergency (oil or chemical spill): 1-800-424-8802

Report Violations:

AFGD Safeguard Program: 1-800-478-3377

properties.name: Sea Lion Rookery Buffer Area - Outer (Pye) Island
properties.information:
No Take Area
Managed By: NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service
Effective From: to

Restricted:

1. No owner or operator of a vessel may enter this area.
2. No person may approach on land not privately owned within one-half statutory mile (0.8 kilometers) or within sight of a rookery site, whichever is greater.
3. Directed fishing for groundfish by vessels named on a Federal Fisheries Permit is prohibited.
4. No discharge of firearms within 100 yards of a steller sea lion.

Allowed:

Navigational transit through Wildcat Pass between Rabbit & Ragged Islands is allowed if the vessel proceeds in continuous transit and maintains a minimum of 1 nautical mile from the rookery site.
Subsistence takings by Alaska Natives are exempt.
Certain activities may be exempt with prior written authorization from the NMFS Regional Administrator.
Emergency situations that present threats to the health, safety, or life of a person or a significant threat to the vessel or property are exempt.
Official government activities related to defense or other legitimate governmental activities are permitted.

Purpose:

To protect threatened Steller sea lions by creating a buffer around established rookeries.

More Information:

properties.name: Sea Lion Rookery Buffer Area - Clubbing Rocks (N) and (S)
properties.information:
No Take Area
Managed By: NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service
Effective From: to

Restricted:

1. No owner or operator of a vessel may enter this area.
2. No person may approach on land not privately owned within one-half statutory mile (0.8 kilometers) or within sight of a rookery site, whichever is greater.
3. Directed fishing for groundfish by vessels named on a Federal Fisheries Permit is prohibited.
4. No discharge of firearms within 100 yards of a steller sea lion.

Allowed:

Navigational transit through Akutan Pass between Clubbing Rocks & Cherni Island is allowed if the vessel proceeds in continuous transit and maintains a minimum of 1 nautical mile from the rookery site.
Subsistence takings by Alaska Natives are exempt.
Certain activities may be exempt with prior written authorization from the NMFS Regional Administrator.
Emergency situations that present threats to the health, safety, or life of a person or a significant threat to the vessel or property are exempt.
Official government activities related to defense or other legitimate governmental activities are permitted.

Purpose:

To protect threatened Steller sea lions by creating a buffer around established rookeries.

MPA Information Provided By ProtectedSeas

properties.name: Sea Lion Rookery Buffer Area - Kiska Island/Lief Cove
properties.information:
No Take Area
Managed By: NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service
Effective From: to

Restricted:

1. No owner or operator of a vessel may enter this area.
2. No person may approach on land not privately owned within one-half statutory mile (0.8 kilometers) or within sight of a rookery site, whichever is greater.
3. Directed fishing for groundfish by vessels named on a Federal Fisheries Permit is prohibited.
4. No discharge of firearms within 100 yards of a steller sea lion.

Allowed:

Subsistence takings by Alaska Natives are exempt.
Certain activities may be exempt with prior written authorization from the NMFS Regional Administrator.
Emergency situations that present threats to the health, safety, or life of a person or a significant threat to the vessel or property are exempt.
Official government activities related to defense or other legitimate governmental activities are permitted.

Purpose:

To protect threatened Steller sea lions by creating a buffer around established rookeries.

More Information:

Get the latest news and information for commercial, subsistence, and sport fishing and hunting to ensure you are legally taking fish and wildlife.

properties.name: Walrus Islands State Game Sanctuary
properties.information:
Fishing Heavily Restricted
Managed By: Alaska Department of Fish and Game
Year-round


Restricted:

A permit is required for access to Round Island and adjacent waters within three miles of Round Island.

Allowed:

Access to other portions of the Walrus Islands State Game Sanctuary does not require an Access Permit and is open to most public uses provided the activity does not damage refuge resources, disturb wildlife or disrupt existing public uses. Allowed activities generally include fishing, wildlife watching, hiking and camping. Other activities may require prior approval from ADF&G through issuance of a Special Areas Permit.

Purpose:

To protect a group of seven small craggy islands and their adjacent waters in northern Bristol Bay. The sanctuary contains one of the largest terrestrial haul out sites for Pacific walrus and protects important habitats for seabirds, Steller sea lions, and other marine and terrestrial birds and mammals.

More Information:

Get the latest news and information for commercial, subsistence, and sport fishing and hunting to ensure you are legally taking fish and wildlife.

properties.name: NAVAREA XII 345/20
properties.information:
GULF OF PANAMA.
PANAMA.
1. THE GULF OF PANAMA IS A CRITICAL HABITAT
FOR HUMPBACK WHALE MIGRATION AND
BREEDING, AND FOR OTHER SPECIES OF WHALES
FEEDING THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.
2. 01 AUG THRU 30 NOV THERE IS A MAXIMUM SPEED
LIMIT OF 10 KNOTS WHILE TRANSITING THE
TRAFFIC SEPARATION SCHEME
IN AREA BOUND BY
08-00.0N 079-28.2W, 08-44.0N 079-28.0W,
08-44.0N 079-23.9W, 08-35.0N 079-20.9W,
08-00.0N 079-20.9W.
3. CANCEL THIS MSG 01 DEC 20.//
